title: International Anti-Corruption Day today
body: International Anti-Corruption Day will be observed across the globe today with the theme ‘Uniting with Youth Against Corruption: Shaping Tomorrow’s Integrity’. To celebrate the day with enthusiasm, the Anti-Corruption Commission of Bangladesh will hold various programmes, said ACC deputy director for public relations Aktarul Islam. The day’s activities will begin at 8:30am with the national anthem and the hoisting of the national flag and the ACC flag at the anti-corruption agency’s headquarters at Segunbagicha in the capital Dhaka. A human chain will be held with the participation of the ACC officials and employees in front of the ACC headquarters at 9:00am. Later, a discussion will be held at 10:00am at the National Theatre Hall Auditorium of the Bangladesh Shilpakala Academy with ACC chairman Mohammad Abdul Momen in the chair. The discussion will be attended by finance adviser Salehuddin Ahmed as the chief guest and Bangladesh Institute of Development Studies director general AK Enamul Haque as the special guest. The day will also be observed at the divisional, district, and upazila levels across the country. To mark International Anti-Corruption Day, the Transparency International Bangladesh will organise a discussion on ‘The State of Media in Bangladesh After the Fall of Authoritarianism’ at 11:00am at its office in the capital’s Dhanmondi. Following the discussion, the names of the winners of the TIB ‘Investigative Journalism Award 2025’ in the field of anti-corruption reporting will be announced at the event and the awards will be handed over to the winners.
